title: PHPatan2()Function

metadata.description: Learn about PHPatan2()Function with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
content_sections.content:
Example Return the arc tangent of two variables with the atan2() function: "); echo(atan2(-0.50,-0.50) . "
"); echo(atan2(5,5) . "
"); echo(atan2(10,20) . "
"); echo(atan2(-5,-5) . "
"); echo(atan2(-10,10)); ?> Definition and Usage The atan2() function returns the arc tangent of y/x, in radians. Where x and y are the coordinates of a point (x,y). Syntax atan2( y,x ); Parameter Values Parameter Description y Required. Specifies a positive or negative number x Required. Specifies a positive or negative number Technical Details Return Value: The arc tangent of y/x in radians, which is between -PI and PI Return Type: Float PHP Version: 4+ ★ +1

summary: This tutorial covers PHPatan2()Function concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPatan2()Function effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPatan2()Function and how to apply it in your projects.
